Package org.hallebarde.recrutement.api

Interface Game

public interface Game
The game you will be interacting with.

  • Method Details

    • getUserCount

      int getUserCount()
      Returns:
      the number of active users.
      See Also:
      • getUsers()
      • getUser(String)

    • getUser

      User getUser(String name)
      Gives access to logged-in users by name.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the user to find.
      Returns:
      the user, or null if it is not found.
      See Also:
      • getUserCount()
      • getUsers()

    • getUsers

      User[] getUsers()
      Returns:
      all logged-in users.
      See Also:
      • getUserCount()
      • getUser(String)

    • broadcast

      void broadcast(String message)
      Sends a message to all logged-in players.
      Parameters:
      message - a message to send.

    • registerCommand

      void registerCommand(String prefix, Command command, String description) throws IllegalStateException
      Registers a command the server can respond to.
      Parameters:
      prefix - the prefix this command should be invoked with.
      command - a command to register.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - in case a command with the same prefix has been registered already.
      NullPointerException - if either the command prefix or the command executor is null.

    • getConfig

      GameConfig getConfig()
      Returns:
      this game's config.

    • runOnGameLoop

      void runOnGameLoop(Runnable task)
      Schedules a task to be run on the main game thread.
      Parameters:
      task - a task to run

    • stop

      void stop(String message)
      Stops the server.
      Parameters:
      message - a message to broadcast to players to inform them, or null to send nothing

    • getWorld

      World getWorld()
      Returns:
      the world this game is running

    • startActivityNow

      void startActivityNow(Activity activity)
      Starts the given activity. If any of the users of the given activity already has an activity going, it will be stopped.
      Parameters:
      activity - the activity to start
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if activity is null
      See Also:
      • startActivityWhenPossible(Activity)
      • stopActivity(Activity)

    • startActivityWhenPossible

      void startActivityWhenPossible(Activity activity)
      Starts the given activity. Waits for all users involved to not have an activity in-going.
      Parameters:
      activity - the activity to start
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if activity is null
      See Also:
      • startActivityNow(Activity)
      • stopActivity(Activity)

    • stopActivity

      void stopActivity(Activity activity)
      Stops the given activity.
      Parameters:
      activity - the activity to stop
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if activity is null
      IllegalStateException - if the activity is not ongoing
      See Also:
      • startActivityNow(Activity)
      • startActivityWhenPossible(Activity)

    • getPlugins

      Map<String,Plugin> getPlugins()
      Provides access to the plugins which have been loaded into this game server.
      Returns:
      an unmodifiable map which associate plugin ids with their instances

    • getPluginMetadata

      PluginMetadata getPluginMetadata(String pluginId)
      Provides access to a plugin's metadata.
      Parameters:
      pluginId - the id of the plugin you need the metadata for
      Returns:
      the plugin's metadata

    • registerEventHandler

      void registerEventHandler(Object object)
      Registers an event handler. An event handler is an object with at least one method annotated with SubscribeEvent. Such methods are void and consume a single Event argument. They are called when an event of the corresponding type is fired using fireEvent(Event).
      Parameters:
      object - the object to register as an event handler
      See Also:
      • Event
      • fireEvent(Event)
      • SubscribeEvent

    • fireEvent

      <E extends Event> E fireEvent(E event)
      Fires an Event that will be propagated to the relevant event subscribing methods.
      Parameters:
      event - the event to fire
      Returns:
      the event that was fired
      See Also:
      • registerEventHandler(Object)
      • Event
      • SubscribeEvent

    • getState

      GameState getState()
      Returns:
      the state the game is currently in

    • getConsole

      Console getConsole()
      Returns:
      the game server console

    • getItemRegistry

      Registry<Item> getItemRegistry()
      Returns:
      the registry that contains all item types known to this server

    • getRoomInteractionRegistry

      Registry<RoomInteraction> getRoomInteractionRegistry()
      Returns:
      the registry that contains all room interactions known to this server
